children.name: when a legal case is judged in court
come to trial
children.definition: if a serious legal case comes to trial, it is judged in a court of law: ra tòa
examples: The case won’t come to trial until next summer.
The British press is not permitted to comment on a case until it comes to trial.

children.name: come before the court
children.definition: come/ be brought before the court if a legal case or a criminal comes or is brought before the court, they go to a court of law so it can be officially decided what further legal action should be taken: bị đem ra trước tòa, bị đem ra xét xử
examples: He thinks his case will come before the court within the next few months.
The case was brought before the court by farmer Brad Morgan.

children.name: be heard
children.definition: if a court case, a problem, or a complaint is heard, a judge or lawyer listens to it to decide what legal action should be taken: được lắng nghe và xét xử
examples: Last year 2,047 cases were heard in the Hillbrow small claims court.
Yesterday counsel for both parties agreed the case should be heard on March 12.

children.name: set aside
children.definition: set sthasideIf a judge or court sets aside a previous decision or judgment, they state that it does not now have any legal effect, usually because they consider it to have been wrong: hủy bỏ, rút lại (phán quyết trước)

children.name: set sthaside/ set aside sth
examples: The Court of Appeal set aside his conviction.

children.name: return a sentence
children.definition: return a verdict/ sentence  to decide and say whether you think sb is guilty or not guilty, or what punishment the person will be given in a law court.
examples: The jury returned a verdictofnot guilty.

children.name: dismiss
children.definition: When a judge dismisses a court case, he or she formally stops the trial, often because there is not enough proof that sb is guilty: bỏ không xét (một vụ); bác (đơn); không thụ lý
examples: The defending lawyer asked that the charge against his client be dismissed.

children.name: sentence
children.definition: if a judge sentences a criminal, he or she gives them an official punishment, usually sending them to prison for a period of time: kết án ,tuyên án

children.name: sentence sb for sth
examples: Brown will be sentenced for a series of sexual assaults.

children.name: sentence sb to 20 years/life imprisonment etc
examples: The judge sentenced Margolis to a year in prison.

children.name: sentence sb to 20 years/life imprisonment etc for sth
examples: Some countries will sentence you to seven or more years in prison for drug offences.

children.name: sentence sb to death: kết án tử ai đó
examples: 60 prisoners have been sentenced to death in political trials.

children.name: pronounce sentence
children.definition: (of a judge) to say officially what a punishment will be: tuyên án
examples: The judge will pronounce sentence on the defendant this afternoon.

children.name: give sb 6 years/10 months etc
children.definition: to send sb to prison for a particular period of time: kết án tuyên án ai đó 6 năm tù/10 tháng tù...
examples: Because of the serious nature of the crime, the judge gave him 20 years.

children.name: give sb 6 years/10 months etc for
examples: After a long trial she was given a life sentence for the bombings.

children.name: to be judged in a court of law
be tried
children.definition: bị xét xử
examples: The suspect will be tried within the next few weeks.
Patterson is being tried for the murder of a 30-year-old Oakland hairdresser.

children.name: be tried for
examples: The two women are being tried for drug smuggling.

children.name: be on trial
children.definition: if sb is on trial, a court of law is trying to decide whether they are guilty or a crime or not: đang bị xét xử
examples: Three men are now on trial after a series of terrorist attacks.
The accused was extradited to Miami earlier this year, and is currently on trial there.

children.name: be on trial for
examples: Three men are on trial for illegally smuggling tropical birds into the country.

children.name: stand trial
children.definition: to be judged in a court of law: bị xét xử
examples: The judge ruled that Pinochet was too ill to stand trial in Spain.
stand trial for
Brady stood trial for the killings late last year.stand trial on
An employee of the bank is due to stand trial on embezzlement charges in February.
Two other men are to stand trial next monthfortheir part in the bombing.

children.name: testify
children.definition: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law: làm chứng
examples: [ + that ]He testifiedthathe had seen the man leaving the building around the time of the murder.
testify against sb[say sth intended to prove sb is guilty] làm chứng chống lại ai
The witness who had testified against him withdrew her allegation.

children.name: Police had to guard him in hospital until he was well enough to testify.testify that
examples: I’m prepared to testify in court that I was in Carolyn’s apartment that night.

children.name: oath
children.definition: a formal promise to tell the truth in a court of law
examples: Witnesses swear a solemn oath to tell the truth.
Public officials must take an oath to support the US Constitution.
Witnesses are required totake the oath(= make this promise ).
on/ under oath:
The evidence was given under oath.

children.name: representation
children.definition: when sb speaks, acts,or is present officially for sb else: sự đại diện
examples: Can he affordlegalrepresentation?

children.name: representation of
examples: She received praise for her effective representation of Garcia during the trial.

children.name: settlement
children.definition: an arrangement to end a disagreement involving a law having been broken, without taking it to a court of law, or an amount of money paid as part of such an arrangement: thoả thuận/ tiền thỏa thuận (để tránh phải ra tòa)
examples: Theyreachedanout-of-courtsettlement.
Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt toreach a settlement.
His lawyers are understood to benegotiating a settlement.

children.name: a divorce settlement(= an agreement about money and property at the end of a marriage )
examples: She acquired full ownership of the building in her 1986 divorce settlement.

children.name: an out-of-court settlement(= an agreement made to avoid a court case)
examples: The army denied liability but agreed on an out-of-court settlement.

children.name: settlement of
examples: The actor accepted a settlementof£100 000 from the newspaper.

children.name: plead
children.definition: to make a statement of what you believe to be true, especially in support of something or someone or when someone has been accused in a law court: bào chữa, biện hộ, cãi
examples: They paid a high-powered attorney to plead theircase(= argue for them in court) .
The judge ruled her unfit to plead (= to answer a legal charge) on the grounds of insanity.

children.name: an official decision made by a court
ruling
children.definition: an official decision, especially one made by a court: quyết định (của quan toà..)
examples: [ + that ]The court has made a final rulingonthe casethatthe companies acted illegally.

children.name: the recent Supreme Court ruling on defendants’ rights
judgment
children.definition: an official legal decision: quyết định của toà; phán quyết
examples: It is the judgmentofthis court that you are guilty of murder.
We are still waiting for the court topass/pronouncejudgment (= give a decision)onthe case.

children.name: verdict
children.definition: the decision that a judge or jury makes about whether someone is guilty of a crime or not: guilty/not guilty verdict:lời tuyên án, lời phán quyết
examples: The jury’s not guilty verdict was criticized all over the country.

children.name: reach a verdictfinally decide whether someone is guilty or not
examples: Jurors were unable to reach a verdict after deliberating two hours Friday afternoon.

children.name: return/ hand down a verdictofficially say whether sb is guilty or not
examples: The judge will hand down a verdict in January, the newspaper reported.

children.name: a verdict of guilty/ not guilty
examples: The foreman read the verdict of guilty fourteen times, one for each defendant.

children.name: exhibit
children.definition: noun  a thing used as evidence in a trial: tang vật
examples: Is exhibit C the weapon which you say was used?
the first exhibit was a knife which the prosecution claimed was the murder weapon.

children.name: alibi
children.definition: proof that sb who is thought to have committed a crime could not have done it, especially the fact or statement that they were in another place at the time it happened: chứng cớ ngoại phạm (chứng tỏ khi sự việc xảy ra thì mình ở nơi khác)
examples: He has a cast-iron(= very strong) alibi-he was in hospital the week of the murder.

children.name: a perfect/ cast-iron/ unshakeable etc alibi
examples: Hehada perfectalibiand the police let him go.

children.name: evidence
children.definition: the information, objects, documents etc that are used in a court to help to prove what really happened in a legal case: chứng cứ, bằng chứng
examples: Prosecutors believe they have enough evidence to convict Smith.
The government’s case was based on evidence gathered over a two-year investigation.
The evidence proves clearly and beyond a reasonable doubt that the defendant is guilty.

children.name: piece of evidence
examples: The most important piece of evidence, the murder weapon, has not been found.

children.name: give evidencetell a court what you know about a crime
examples: His former girlfriend was called to give evidence.

children.name: give evidence against sbtell the court things that help to prove someone is guilty
examples: Husbands and wives cannot be forced to give evidence against each other.

children.name: trial
children.definition: a legal process in a court, in which people try out find out whether or not sb is guilty of a crime: phiên tòa
examples: The trial is due to take place next month at Wood Green Crown Court.

children.name: a awaiting trialto be waiting for your trial to start
examples: Drake is in a federal prison in Houston, awaiting trial on charges of cocaine trafficking.

children.name: a face trialwait for your trial to start
examples: Perelli faces trial later in the year on corruption and perjury charges.

children.name: a murder/ rape/ robbery etc trial
examples: On Tuesday, a judge rejected requests to televise the murder trial of Robert Caine.

children.name: be on trial (for sth)to be judged in a court
examples: A man from Seattle is on trial for the murder.

children.name: go on trialto begin being judged in a court
examples: A man was due to go on trial at Liverpool Crown Court later today accused of murdering his wife.

children.name: court order
children.definition: an order or decision made by a law court: án lệnh (của tòa án)
examples: His computer was seized under a court order.

children.name: case
children.definition: a particular crime or legal problem that is judged in court: vụ kiện
examples: They lost their case in the High Court and had to pay damages.

children.name: murder/ robbery/ rape etc case
examples: Mathers called it the worst multiple murder case in the city’s history.

children.name: action
children.definition: a legal or formal process to decide whether sb has done sth wrong:

children.name: a libel action
examples: Shebroughtan action (fornegligence)againstthe hospital.
Acriminalaction wasbrought againsthim.
The book was halted in South Africa by a threat oflegalaction.
They are threatening totake legal actionagainst the hospital(= start a court case against them ).
The director facesdisciplinary action(= official action to punish him ).
The matter is now the subject of acourt action(= a court case ).
The students agreed todroptheiraction(= decided not to continue with a court case or an official complaint ).
The sistersbrought a libel actionagainst the newspaper(= started a court case ).

children.name: legal/ court action
examples: The singer threatened legal action against the magazine.
The couple are still considering whether to take court action.

children.name: a libel action(= taken against someone who has writen or printed untrue statements about you )
examples: Judge Johan Kreigler dismissed a libel action brought against two newspapers.

children.name: a civil action(= involving business or property, rather than a crime)
examples: The victim can seek damages in a civil action.

children.name: take legal action
examples: He is within his rights to take legal action.

children.name: face legal action
examples: The council demanded that we remove the posters, or face legal action.

children.name: bring a legal action
examples: Justice Mayor ruled that she cannot bring a legal action for damages against the plaintiff.

children.name: miscarriage of justice
children.definition: a situation in which sb is wrongly punished for a crime that they were not responsible for: vụ xử oan
examples: ▪Whenever a miscarriage of justice is discovered, people lose respect for the law.
▪The safeguards are intended to prevent a miscarriage of justice.

children.name: a gross miscarriage of justicea very serious miscarriage
examples: ▪The execution was a gross miscarriage of justice against an innocent man.
